intro: Tetradymia stenolepis, commonly known as the narrowleaf tetradymia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds, which contribute to its survival in harsh conditions. Tetradymia stenolepis is often found in open slopes and gravelly soils, where it thrives in full sun.
